items.source: Berezovskyy was the first Ukrainian composer to achieve international recognition as a master of the operatic genre.
His choral works are characterized by deep philosophical reflection and sophisticated polyphonic structures.
The imperial system often suppressed national talents, viewing them as a threat to centralized cultural authority.
His admission to the Bologna Academy confirmed the high level of the Ukrainian musical tradition of the 18th century.
The revival of his legacy is a crucial part of reclaiming Ukraine's European civilizational identity.
